Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.God

Interface UndecoratedWorker

All Known Implementing Classes:
Apollo, Artemis, Athena, Atlas, Demeter, Hephaestus, Hera, Hestia, Limus, Minotaur, NoGod, Pan, Poseidon, Prometheus, Triton, WorkerDecorator, Zeus
public interface UndecoratedWorker
This is the interface that implements the Decorator Pattern for Workers and God Powers.

The Decorator Pattern grants new behaviors to be added to an individual object without affecting other objects from the same class.

Since:
1.0

    • canMove

      boolean canMove​(Tile t)
      Checks if the worker can move to a specific Tile.
      Parameters:
      t - Variable that indicates the Tile at issue.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if the "move" operation is available, otherwise false.

      Gets the position of the worker at issue.
      Returns:
      The Tile where the worker is positioned upon.

    • setPosition

      void setPosition​(Tile t)
      Sets the position of a worker in a specified Tile.
      Parameters:
      t - The destination Tile where the worker must be put on.

    • getGodPower

      boolean getGodPower()
      Checks the GodPower of the worker associated.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if GodPower at issue is active, otherwise false.

    • setGodPower

      void setGodPower​(boolean b)
      Sets the GodPower of the worker associated.
      Parameters:
      b - A boolean: true if the GodPower at issue is active, otherwise false.

    • getConditions

      Conditions getConditions()
      Gets the particular conditions of specific Gods.
      Returns:
      The conditions class is where the info about particular conditions of specific Gods is stored.

    • useGodPower

      void useGodPower​(boolean use)
      Handles the use of the GodPower of specific Gods.
      Parameters:
      use - A boolean: true if the worker activates a particular condition, otherwise false.

    • getBelongToPlayer

      int getBelongToPlayer()
      Checks which player the worker at issue is associated to.
      Returns:
      An integer that represents the player ID which the worker is associated with.

    • checkWin

      boolean checkWin​(Tile initialTile)
      Check if any winning condition is satisfied.

      The main win condition is for the worker of the player to "move" from a level 2 block to a level 3 block.

      Parameters:
      initialTile - Variable that represents the initial Tile of the "move" operation.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if any winning condition is satisfied, otherwise false.

    • nextState

      void nextState()
      Brings the worker to the next state in the turn.

    • setState

      void setState​(int state)
      Sets the worker to a particular state in the turn.
      Parameters:
      state - Variable that represents the index of the state in the turn.

      If index equals 0: waiting;

      If index equals 1: moving;

      If index equals 2: building;

      If index equals 3: using another worker;

    • getState

      int getState()
      Gets the state in the specified turn.
      Returns:
      An integer that represents the number of the state in the turn.

      If index equals 0: waiting;

      If index equals 1: moving;

      If index equals 2: building;

      If index equals 3: using another worker;

    • getAdjacentTiles

      java.util.List<Tile> getAdjacentTiles()
      Analyzes all the adjacent tiles near the position of the worker.
      Returns:
      A list of all the adjacent tiles near the position of the worker.
